title: Charlotte Police - Threats over Rainbow Story Time

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the North Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1) A copy of any threatening email (or any report concerning any threatening email) to the Durham County Library on or about Saturday, April 13, 2024.

2) Any recording of, transcript of, or report concerning any threatening phone call  to the Durham County Library on or about Saturday, April 13, 2024.

3) A copy of any threatening email (or any report concerning any threatening email) sent to WBTV on April 13, 2024.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: Talking points and other material related to 4/19/2024 press conference

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Talking points and other material related to 4/19/2024 press conference
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any talking points, notes, or scripts prepared for the press conference mentioned here 

https://twitter.com/VibrantRRHA/status/1780986538077098003

created between April 1, 2024 and the time this request is processed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia.
